Class Controller

java.lang.Object
Controller
public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
This class is the controller for all the actions for the GUI and will connect with the TuitionManager to keep track of the Students.
Author:
Chris Zachariah (cvz2), Anthony Topol (at877)

      public Controller()

  • Method Details

    • addNewStudent

      public void addNewStudent()
      This method is connected to the Add Button to add a new Student to the list.

    • addInStateStudent

      private void addInStateStudent​(java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String lastName, int credits)
      This private method is used to add Instate Students to the list.
      Parameters:
      firstName - is the first name of the Student
      lastName - is the last name of the Student
      credits - is the number of credits that the Student is taking

    • addInstateGUI

      private boolean addInstateGUI​(java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String lastName, int credits, int funding)
      This method is used by addInStateStudent() to add InState Students to the list.
      Parameters:
      firstName - is the first name of the Student
      lastName - is the last name of the Student
      credits - is the number of credits that the Student is taking
      funding - is the amount of funding that the Student has
      Returns:
      true if the Student was added and false if the Student was already in list to begin with

    • addOutStateStudent

      private void addOutStateStudent​(java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String lastName, int credits)
      This is a private method used to add Out-State Students to the list.
      Parameters:
      firstName - is the first name of the Student
      lastName - is the last name of the Student
      credits - is the number of credits that the Student is taking

    • addOutStateGUI

      private boolean addOutStateGUI​(java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String lastName, int credits, boolean isTriState)
      This method is used by addOutStateStudent() to add an Out-Of-State Student to the list.
      Parameters:
      firstName - the first name of the Student
      lastName - the last name of the Student
      credits - is number of credits the Student is taking
      isTriState - if the Student is in the tri-state or not
      Returns:
      true if the Student was added and false if the Student is already in the list

    • addInternationalStudent

      private void addInternationalStudent​(java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String lastName, int credits)
      This is a private method used to add an International Student to the list.
      Parameters:
      firstName - is the first name of the Student
      lastName - is the last name of the Student
      credits - is the number of credits that the Student is taking

    • addInternGUI

      private boolean addInternGUI​(java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String lastName, int credits, boolean isExchange)
      This method is used by addInternationalStudent() to add an International Student to the list.
      Parameters:
      firstName - is the first name of the Student
      lastName - is the last name of the Student
      credits - is the number of credits the Student is taking
      isExchange - if the Student has exchange status or not
      Returns:
      true if the Student was added or false if the Student was already in the list

    • InStateRadioButtonClicked

      public void InStateRadioButtonClicked()
      This method is connected to the InState Radio Button. Will toggle the other radio buttons off and make sure the funding checkbox and the funding text field is enabled. Will do the opposite if the button is pressed again.

    • OutStateRadioButtonClicked

      public void OutStateRadioButtonClicked()
      This method is connected to the OutState Radio Button. This method will disable all checkbox options except for tri-state, disable the funding text field, and turn the OutStateRadioButtonClicked on. It will also toggle the other radio buttons off. Will do the opposite if the button is clicked again.

    • InternationalRadioButtonClicked

      public void InternationalRadioButtonClicked()
      This method is connected to the International Radio Button. It will toggle the other radio buttons off and only enable the exchange status checkbox. Will do the opposite if the button is clicked again.

    • fundingBoxClicked

      public void fundingBoxClicked()
      This method can be used to turn on the Funding checkbox. The other checkboxes will be toggled off.

    • triStateBoxClicked

      public void triStateBoxClicked()
      This method can be used to turn on the Tri-State checkbox. The other checkboxes will be toggled off.

    • exchangeBoxClicked

      public void exchangeBoxClicked()
      This method can be used to turn on the Exchange checkbox. The other checkboxes will be toggled off.

    • setAllDefault

      private void setAllDefault()
      This method can be used to set all the areas of the GUI to its default after adding and removing Students.

    • removeStudent

      public void removeStudent()
      This method is used to remove a Student from the list.

    • removeGUI

      private boolean removeGUI​(java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String lastName)
      This method is used by removeStudent() to remove a Student from the list.
      Parameters:
      firstName - the first name of the Student
      lastName - the last name of the Student
      Returns:
      true if the Student was removed or false if the Student could not be found in the list

    • printStudents

      public void printStudents()
      This method will be connected to the Print button. This will print out the current Students that are in the list along with the tuition that each one needs to pay.
